title: PMO SOP – Pre-Initiation Phase
summary: Define and assess the strategic need, business case, and alignment of the project with organizational goals before formal initiation.

title: Initiation Phase
summary: Phase 2 covers formally initiate the project with defined scope, stakeholders, and initial planning.. Includes 6 key activities and produces 4 deliverables. Key focus areas: Assign Project Manager, Conduct stakeholder analysis, Define high-level scope and objectives.

title: Design and Plan

title: Implement and Control
summary: Phase 4 covers execute project work, track progress, and manage changes and risks.. Includes 6 key activities and produces 4 deliverables. Key focus areas: Lead project execution against baseline plan, Monitor schedule, budget, and deliverables, Manage scope and change control.
description: Execute project work, track progress, and manage changes and risks.

title: Close and Realize Benefits
